label: false
title: Rapper Eminem contacted coronavirus.
explanation: The post is a hoax.

label: mostly false
title: The coronavirus is a bioweapon by the USA, says German politician Wolfgang Gedeon in a Parliament speech.
explanation: International scientists, the WHO and German Robert Koch Institute see strong evidence that the coronavirus is of natural origin and its outbreak is related to bats.

label: false
title: Israel creates a vaccine for the coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: 10 coronavirus cases are confirmed in Ecuador.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Vitamin C prevents coronavirus.
explanation: Researchers reject that there should be any evidence to suggest that vitamin C intake can prevent COVID-19. With a healthy level of vitamin C, you can shorten a cold, but that does not mean that you can prevent or treat COVID-19 by consuming large amounts of vitamin C.

label: four pinocchios
title: Trump’s effort to blame Obama for sluggish coronavirus testing.
explanation: There was no “Obama rule,” just draft guidance that never took effect and was withdrawn before President Trump took office.

label: false
title: Dr. Lupita Yamamoto has found a vaccine that destroys the coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: China names COVID-19 the ”Japanese pneumonia”.
explanation: This is a widespread mistranslation of a sentence in a Chinese report that read "日本新型冠状病毒肺炎疫情不断变化" and which means "the situation with infections of the novel coronavirus in Japan is constantly in flux."

label: false
title: The first coronavirus case in North Macedonia was a well-known fashion designer.
explanation: Due to the mass dissemination of the misinformation, Pandeva (the designer) addressed the public through a video message posted on her Facebook profile and denied that she was ill.

label: false
title: Colombia closes its borders to Ecuadorians.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: misleading
title: Ads are selling masks protecting against COVID-19.
explanation: U.S. authorities don't recommend wearing masks and the doctor does not speak about COVID-19.

label: false
title: People queue outside an Aldi supermarket in Germany to buy food in fear of the new coronavirus.
explanation: The 2011 video shows the opening of an Aldi store.

label: false
title: First coronavirus case in Ambato, Ecuador.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: The media group Globo published a photo of the dead of the Lampedusa shipwreck as if they were COVID-19 victims.
explanation: The image shows coffins of immigrants killed in the tragedy on the island of Lampedusa in 2013, but Aos Fatos found no evidence that the Globo group used the record outside its original context. G1, a site that belongs to Globo, denied misinformation that circulated in March and attributed the same image of coffins to the pandemic.

label: false
title: The coronavirus has been discovered in poultry.
explanation: Sri Lankan authorities said the coronavirus has not been discovered in poultry. The photos were taken from various unrelated reports online and show chickens sickened with other diseases.

label: misleading
title: A health expert surmises that the new coronavirus might not spread in Nigeria because of the hot temperature.
explanation: Warmer air holds more moisture, preventing airborne viruses from traveling as far as they would in dry air. But it is not confirmed if the new coronavirus is vulnerable to hot temperature.

label: false
title: Video shows Wuhan residents lining up for death certificates.
explanation: The video previously circulated in reports about Wuhan residents gathering to collect free vegetables.

label: false
title: Chinese official detainted a CoV case.
explanation: It was an exercise.

label: partially false
title: Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from the new coronavirus.
explanation: Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.

label: misleading
title: Russia said COVID-19 is man-made.
explanation: The Russian Ministry of Health denies making such a statement; the document states COVID-19 is a “recombinant virus” which can form naturally.

label: false
title: Vinegar is more effective than alcohol-based hand sanitizers for killing the novel coronavirus.
explanation: Vinegar is not effective as a hand sanitizer. Its effects on breaking up the fat protection around viruses are very limited. Alcohol and soap are very effective as protection.

label: false
title: There is a case of coronavirus at the School of Architects of Madrid.
explanation: The event depicted was an exercise.

label: false
title: Claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.
explanation: Medical experts told AFP there was no evidence to support the theory about drinking garlic water; international health organisations do not recommend the remedy and have said there is no specific antiviral treatment for the new strain of the novel coronavirus.

label: false
title: A Nigerian taxi driver threatens to spread COVID-19.
explanation: The claim originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured and by government officials.

label: misleading
title: A man is hospitalized after eating a bat.
explanation: This photo that has circulated in an online fundraising page features a man with a lung condition unrelated to the novel coronavirus.

label: false
title: The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The frames were taken from different episodes, about the Osaka flu and the housecat flu. One of them was digitally manipulated to include the word "coronavirus."

label: false
title: The photos show Indians bathing in cow dung to prevent infection.
explanation: The photos show participants at an annual cow dung festival held in the southern region of India in October 2019, several weeks before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan.

label: partially false
title: Multiple allegations on how to protect oneself from CoV.
explanation: Many of the practices detailed in the post are misleading and inaccurate.

label: false
title: Drinking hot water prevents the COVID-19
explanation: This information is false. Health authorities do not recognize hot water as a preventive measure and experts point out that it could be counterproductive.

label: false
title: Two cases of coronavirus have been reported in Loja, in Ecuador.

label: false
title: You can’t get infected by kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue.
explanation: Kissing the hands of a virgin or saint statue is a tradition of the Holy Week in some parts of Spain, but it is not free from viruses and therefore can be a way of infection.

label: false
title: Azuay Governor in Ecuador seeks the cure of covid-19 in indigenous medicine.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: This video was supposedly developed by the Ecuadorian Health Ministry to encourage people to wash their hands constantly.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

explanation: A 2017 CDC infographic shows how facial hair could interfere with respirator masks. The graphic is unrelated to coronavirus protection and the CDC has not recommended people should shave their beards to ward off the virus.

label: false

explanation: The claim is from the satirical website Cerebrother.

explanation: The pope tested negative.

explanation: The Vatican and the embassy said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold.

explanation: There is no approved coronavirus vaccine.

label: false
title: Ecuadorean doctor develops a vaccine for COVID-19.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

title: An audio clip claims Kenya has recorded 63 cases of COVID-19.
explanation: The audio clip was edited and taken out of context. It was part of a training exercise by the Ministry of Health to prepare for a likely outbreak ahead of the opening of a quarantine center in Nairobi.

label: false

explanation: No such announcement has been made.

label: false
title: A new case of coronavirus has been confirmed in Tulcán, Ecuador.

label: false
title: Turkish raki prevents COVID-19.
explanation: The video clip was doctored. There is no evidence that shows raki prevents the disease.

label: false

explanation: Misbar checked the educational bulletin attributed to UNICEF and found it to be false, and completely different from the original bulletin found on the official website of the organization.

label: false
title: This video shows dead coronavirus victims amassed in the Bergamo (or Brescia) hospital.
explanation: The video was recorded in Ecuador at the Los Ceibos General Hospital in Guayaquil.

label: false
title: Japanese Asahi Shimbun TV
explanation: The original news clip suggested that there could be some COVID-19 cases being misdiagnosed as flu in the U.S. But it didn't mention that COVID-19 originated in the U.S.

label: false
title: Coronavirus dies in temperatures 26-27C and when exposed to sunlight.
explanation: There are no studies to support this claim.

label: false
title: Ecuadorian doctor develops a vaccine for COVID-19.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Two cases of coronavirus have been reported in Loja, Ecuador.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Bloggers say the Vatican reports that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus before a second test came back positive.
explanation: An Italian newspaper reported that Pope Francis tested negative for the coronavirus. The Vatican has not confirmed or denied the report.

label: false
title: Images of BJP men smearing cow dung on one another after their party leader Suman Haripriya said cow dung may help cure coronavirus.
explanation: Assam BJP MLA Suman Haripriya made those statements on 3/2/20. But the images are from the Goraihabba festival celebrated in Thalavadi (Tamil Nadu) on 10/30/19.

label: false
title: Coronavirus can be transmitted through imported goods
explanation: The virus cannot live outside the human body for a long time.

label: false
title: Video shows President Donald Trump saying COVID-19 is the Democrats’ “new hoax.”
explanation: The video makes it look like Trump called coronavirus “their new hoax.” There was nearly a full minute between when the president said “coronavirus” and “hoax” during a 2/28/20 rally in North Charleston, S.C.

label: misleading
title: Vitamin C can cure COVID-19.
explanation: The claim is not based on medical evidence.

label: misleading
title: Spices can ward off the new coronavirus.
explanation: Spices can increase endurance but there is no evidence that they can prevent or cure coronavirus.

label: false
title: Drink (warm) water or gargle every 15 minutes to rinse the new coronavirus down.
explanation: There is no scientific evidence that drinking warm water can prevent the new coronavirus.

label: false
title: A study published by two Chinese research institutions suggest that human semen can cure COVID-19.
explanation: The screenshot of the report circulated online was digitally manipulated. The original report suggested another medicine could be the cure, not human semen.

label: false
title: Plant-based cure for coronavirus discovered in Iran.
explanation: The plant-based product has not been approved or submitted for approval to Iranian authorities, according to the official news agency.

label: false
title: Azuay governor in Ecuador seeks the cure of COVID-19 in indigenous medicine.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: misleading
title: These are seven “evil” things COVID-19 is “afraid” of.
explanation: The claim is misleading; health experts say such practices are only effective when applied properly and can be harmful if used incorrectly.

label: false
title: A runny nose and sputum secretion are not symptoms of novel coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO listed these as possible symptoms.

label: false
title: Video claims that “The health system is collapsing” in North Macedonia.
explanation: A false claim in the video 4/3/20 is that Macedonia has by far the lowest number of tested compared to other countries. Data for 4/4/20 shows Macedonia is the second country in the region in terms of the number of tests conducted for COVID-19 per million inhabitants. Another false claim is that the number of cases per capita is the highest in Macedonia from the entire region, but as of 4/7/20, the number of cases per capita in Macedonia is somewhere in the middle compared to the whole region.

label: false
title: Twitter users said Adutwumwaa Bitters cure coronavirus.
explanation: Producers of the medicine, Adutwumwaa Herbal Industries Limited, have stated that their product does not cure coronavirus. The WHO says there’s no cure, vaccine or antiviral medicine to prevent or treat coronavirus.

label: false
title: Viral photo in Nigeria suggests former President Obasanjo said there is no coronavirus in Nigeria and that the minister of health lied.
explanation: President Obasanjo's spokesperson, Kehinde Akinyemi, refuted allegations attributed to Baba; a moniker often used to describe the former head of state. A Google reverse image search revealed that the "Fox News writer" (the source) used the image out of context.

label: false
title: This photo shows a brothel in Europe where people have been quarantined.
explanation: The claim originated on a satirical website based in Spain. The photo is of a nightclub in Marbella.

label: false
title: Uganda has recorded its first coronavirus case from Chinese nationals at the Entebbe Regional Referral Hospital.
explanation: As of Mar 3rd, Uganda’s Minister of Health, Dr Jane Ruth Aceng,stated that they were all tested negative, and that Uganda is yet to record a COVID-19 case.

label: false
title: Disinfectant gel causes cancer.
explanation: There have been no credible studies to prove this, according to health experts.

label: false
title: Constant sex kills coronavirus.
explanation: Sex cannot kill or cure coronavirus. But close contact with an infected person will expose the partner to the disease.

label: misleading
title: Outbreak of COVID-19 is a worldwide fake. The fatality rate is too low for an epidemic. The WHO admitted causing the SARS outbreak in 2003.
explanation: There are thousands of confirmed cases around the globe. The virus is confirmed in multiple labs. The fatality rate is greater than that of some of pandemics in the 20th century.

label: false
title: Israeli scientists have developed a COVID-19 vaccine.
explanation: Israel's Migal Institute said it was still working to develop a vaccine. The photo is from a stock photo website.

label: false
title: Ecuadorean youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene supposedly infected with COVID-19.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: 12 pieces of advice for coronavirus, including symptoms, transmission, how to neutralize the virus.
explanation: Most of the advice is false or unfounded.

label: false
title: Ambulance health care workers are transporting a corona patient in The Hague (The Netherlands), dressed in white protective suits.
explanation: Medical personnel and news websites had already stated this patiënt was not infected with the coronavirus.

label: false
title: A bovine coronavirus vaccine, for cattle, is proof that the novel coronavirus isn’t “new” and is evidence of “how much the media controls people.”
explanation: The cattle vaccine has nothing to do with the COVID-19 virus.

label: false
title: Post says two patients at Valley Regional Medical Center in Brownsville, Texas, “are being looked at” for possible coronavirus infections.
explanation: Health officials say there are no coronavirus patients in the Rio Grande Valley as of 3/3/20.

label: false
title: Local hospital in Ecuador says first covid patient didn’t have coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: 3.000 people from Elche (Spain) are infected with the coronavirus after coming back from Milan’s international footwear industry fair.
explanation: As of 3/2/20, there are no coronavirus cases in Elche; the Ministry of Health has not released a statement claiming any cases.

label: false
title: There are cases of coronavirus in the Amazon forest.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Man critical with novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, India.
explanation: There is no confirmed case of the novel coronavirus in Barhalganj, a town in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh.The man did not get infected with coronavirus in Barhalganj by consuming chicken.

label: false
title: Alcohol kills the coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is fake.

label: false
title: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.
explanation: The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.

label: false
title: Post says “sanitizer will do nothing for the coronavirus.”
explanation: Although they are not effective against all viruses, hand sanitizers with high alcohol content have proven effective against human coronaviruses.

label: false
title: The pope has COVID-19.
explanation: The Vatican press office announced the pope has a common cold and is continuing his schedule.

label: false
title: Ministry of Health confirms new case of coronavirus in Santa Elena province, Ecuador.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: The Ministry of Health in Spain issues advice about the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The Ministry of Health has not issued an alert.

label: false
title: Whatsapp message contains multiple health advises.
explanation: The text message is based on advice lacking scientific evidence. The WHO does not confirm any of them.

label: false
title: U.S. Vice President Pence urged people with coronavirus to go to the police.
explanation: This claim is false; Pence never said this.

label: mostly true
title: The United States is “actually screening fewer people (for the coronavirus than other countries) because we don’t have appropriate testing.”
explanation: The CDC has stopped publicly reporting the number of tests it’s administered. As of March 4, the United States has lagged behind other nations in terms of coronavirus testing.

label: false
title: There is a new case of coronavirus in Latacunga, Ecuador.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Multiple videos claim garlic and onions can prevent and cure infection from the novel coronavirus.
explanation: This claim is false. The WHO says garlic cannot prevent or treat COVID-19.

label: false
title: This is a video of panicked shoppers storming a supermarket amid the coronavirus pandemic.
explanation: The claim is false; the video was filmed in Germany in 2011, nearly a decade before the coronavirus pandemic broke out.

label: false
title: Local hospital in Ecuador says first COVID-19 patient didn’t have coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: In North Korea, a person was allegedly shot by local authorities when he violated the quarantine rule and went to a public restroom.
explanation: Due to complete state control of information and news in North Korea, claims about COVID-19 cannot be verified. This claim is not confirmed.

label: false
title: Ecuadorian youtuber Raùl Alvarez Guene was supposedly infected with COVID-19.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Classes in Ecuador are suspended because of coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: “Coronavirus hoax
explanation: No credible evidence shows the current coronavirus spreading around the world was fabricated.

label: pants on fire!
title: U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham says President Trump “probably knows more about medicine and specifically viruses than any of the so-called scientists at the NIH and CDC.”
explanation: Sennator Lindsey Graham did not say this.The quote was fabricated by a Twitter account that has posted fake statements in the past.

label: false
title: Notice for preparing emergency drugs was released on social media for alumni of Seoul National University College of Medicine.
explanation: This did not happen.

label: false
title: There are cases of coronavirus in the Amazon forest.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Indonesia has provided 1,000 free tickets for nationals to return home from abroad.
explanation: The Foreign Ministry dismissed the reports as a hoax.

label: misleading
title: Four patients infected with the coronavirus are hospitalized in Sri Lanka.
explanation: Only two suspected patients were hospitalized and both later tested negative.

label: false
title: Images show the Great Mosque of Mecca empty.
explanation: The images are fabricated.

label: false
title: Beware of Yellow Rain (Agent Orange) coming with a storm from China. It brings chemicals and the coronavirus.
explanation: Yellow Rain is not a real rain, it's how to call an chemical weapon in the past. Even a storm is coming, it's unable to bring virus from China to Thailand.

label: false
title: An alkaline diet can prevent coronavirus infection.
explanation: No food or diet, alkaline or otherwise, can prevent the infection

label: false
title: Post says no one has died from the coronavirus in the United States.
explanation: As of 3/3/20, nine people have died from the coronavirus in the United States. The first death was on 3/1/20.

label: false
title: The coronavirus Is spreading in Egyptian schools.
explanation: Misbar found the video shows a poisoning incident at the Technical Secondary School for Girls in Sherbin City, Dakahlia Governorate, north of Cairo.

label: false
title: “Florida hospital reports a coronavirus ‘infestation’ with multiple confirmed patients.”
explanation: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention presumptively confirmed two cases of the 2019 coronavirus in Florida.

label: false
title: The Vatican confirms Pope Francis was infected with coronavirus.
explanation: The claim was denied by the Vatican.

label: false
title: Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
explanation: The Vatican does not confirm this.

label: false
title: Photo shows a man wearing a “government issued Saint Laurent hazardous materials suit.”
explanation: The image was posted by a self-described parody account.

label: false
title: Vatican says Pope Francis has been infected with the novel coronavirus.
explanation: The Vatican said the pope recently fell ill with a common cold..

label: false
title: Photo of Iranian officials visiting the vice president after she contracted COVID-19.
explanation: The photo has circulated since 2014, after one of Iran's vice presidents was injured in a traffic accident.

label: misleading
title: 14 points of expert advice about coronavirus, including symptoms, prevention and how it spreads.
explanation: Research does not support the claims.

label: false
title: This video was shot in a mall in Germany during the coronavirus pandemic.
explanation: The video was filmed years before the pandemic.

label: false
title: “Shands Hospital of Gainesville, Florida, has confirmed its first case of coronavirus.”
explanation: As of 3/2/20, the CDC has confirmed two cases of COVID-19 in Florida. Shands Hospital in Gainesville  has not confirmed a coronavirus case.

label: explanatory
title: Facemasks prevent coronavirus infection.
explanation: Health authorities do not recommend using a face mask unless there is direct contact with a positive diagnosis.

label: false
title: The coronavirus is “simply the common cold.”
explanation: The 2019 coronavirus is part of a family of viruses that produce illnesses ranging from the common cold to more critical diseases such as SARS or MERS. It is a new virus not previously identified.

label: false
title: Garlic water can treat coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO says there is no evidence to confirm this claim.

label: false
title: Local news channel in Ecuador confirms more people are infected with coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: no evidence
title: The coronavirus is more dangerous for animals than for humans.
explanation: There is no proof that animals can get or spread the new coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspends all incoming and outgoing flights to China.
explanation: The Russian government had imposed a temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot, stopped flying to China on 1/31/20. Ikar airline will continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until 2/29/20.

label: false
title: Volcanic ash can kill the coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO says there is no evidence of this.

label: false
title: Pangolin is the original cause of COVID-19.
explanation: The information from scientists who first pointed to pangolin as the cause of the infection has been corrected.

label: false
title: Doctors recommend carbon filter face masks to prevent coronavirus spread.
explanation: Video claim is false. The FDA and CDC concluded they are not effective for children and are not recommended for home use. The videos are used to sell the masks to people concerned about the coronavirus outbreak.

label: false
title: This virus must be old because the label on a bottle of disinfectant from 2015 shows “coronavirus“.
explanation: The coronavirus family is known for decades, so older disinfectants  display its name.

label: false
title: Pope Francis is infected with coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: correct
title: Germany gave medical protection equipment like masks to China, now it’s missing in Germany.
explanation: Germany sent protection equipment to China twice in February.

label: false
title: Drinking warm water or tea can prevent contagions.
explanation: Studies do not prove coronavirus is affected by temperature and or inanimate objects.

label: misleading
title: Mongolia donates 30,000 sheep to China during the coronavirus epidemic.
explanation: The videos circulated before Mongolia announced the donation on 2/27/20.

label: false
title: Taiwanese president and former president were infected. The former president died.
explanation: The images of screenshots and official documents are doctored or forged. President Tsai made a public speech at a 2/28/20 memorial event.

label: false
title: A video shows people storming an Aldi supermarket to buy groceries because of coronavirus fear.
explanation: The video was made in 2011 and shows people eager to buy laptops at an Aldi store in Kiel.

label: false
title: Health Ministry in Ecuador confirms three new cases of coronavirus.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: Pope Francis was diagnosed with coronavirus.
explanation: The pontiff tested negative for COVID-19 after showing flu symptoms.

label: misleading
title: Vitamin helps against COVID-19.
explanation: Health experts told AFP there is insufficient evidence for this claim.

label: false
title: A video of chaos in a shop claims people are panicking after the first confirmed case of coronavirus in Lithuania.
explanation: The video was made in May 2018 in Romania, during a sale at a supermarket.

label: false
title: Tips against coronavirus like holding your breath and drinking water.
explanation: These tips don't prevent infection with coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Election years in the United States coincide with major disease outbreaks.
explanation: Several years of discovery or the associated spread of a disease do not match election years, national and international health organizations said.

label: false
title: Police in China have killed 25,000 COVID-19 patients so far.
explanation: None of the four clips spliced together shows cops “shooting” COVID-19 patients. One is of a road crash; another features not gunshots, but the explosion of Lunar New Year fireworks in the background.

label: pants on fire!
title: A video says the Vatican confirmed Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
explanation: The Vatican has denied the report, saying the pope has a “slight illness.”

label: false
title: The Vatican confirmed that Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
explanation: The Vatican denied allegations that Pope Francis contracted COVID-19.

label: false
title: President Barack Obama “waited six months to call swine flu an emergency after thousands died.”
explanation: The Obama administration declared swine flu, or H1N1, a public health emergency six weeks before H1N1 was declared a pandemic. No H1N1 deaths had yet been recorded in the United States.

label: false
title: CDC recommends men shave their beards to be protected against the new coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is based on a CDC chart created in 2017 to advise medical workers on the best practices for wearing a "filtering facepiece respirator" during contact with viral patients. It was not intended for the general public - nor specifically for preventing the spread of the coronavirus.

label: false
title: COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, in an effort to improve their skin.
explanation: The claim is false and baseless. The photos are a decade old; some show a Chinese man "eating babies" as protest art in 2000.

label: false
title: The Cambodian prime minister has COVID-19.
explanation: The photo is from 2017; the prime minister was treated for something else.

label: false
title: Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection.
explanation: The WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.

label: false
title: Beef meat is the best vaccine against COVID-19.
explanation: There is no evidence to proove this.

label: false
title: Shaving facial hair ensures safety from COVID-19, further attributing the message to the CDC.
explanation: This information was directed to workers who use respirators in carrying out their tasks and has nothing to do with preventing the spread of coronavirus.

label: false
title: Chinese police use a fishing net to arrest a man with a high fever.
explanation: The video shows a police training exercise.

label: misleading
title: Summer temperatures will make coronavirus disappear.
explanation: Not enough is known about the coronavirus to prove this claim.

label: false
title: Barcelona’s council issued a notification of a new focus in two neighborhoods.
explanation: The council denied the claim on its Twitter account.

label: false
title: Florida man is arrested for robbery using cough as a weapon.
explanation: The photo was created using a prank generator site.

label: false
title: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
explanation: The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.

label: false
title: Video of a roof full of bats claims it is the source of coronavirus.
explanation: The video was recorded in Florida in 2011, not in China.

label: false
title: Clients of a brothel in the Spanish city of Valencia are quarantined after one of their employees tested positive for coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is not true; it is a humor article.

label: false
title: Jackie Chan is quarantined because of the coronavirus.
explanation: Jackie Chan states that he was not quarantined.

label: false
title: The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is not true.

label: false
title: The wife of a Chinese shop owner in Totana (Murcia, Spain) has coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is not true.

label: false
title: “Spanish newspaper ABC reports there are two possible COVID-19 cases in Gines and Benecazón (Seville, Spain).
explanation: ABC has not published this article

label: false
title: Video of a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police.
explanation: This video shows a drill. It was shot 2/21/20 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

label: false
title: Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway.
explanation: The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.

label: false
title: A “poll finds 38% of Americans say they will not drink Corona beer because of the virus.”
explanation: The poll was conducted by a PR firm which did not release full details about it.

label: false
title: Authorities should implement temperature tests to travelers from China.
explanation: There is no evidence the tests are precise enough to detect infections with no fever.

label: false
title: “Every election year has a disease” — SARS in 2004; avian flu in 2008; swine flu in 2010; MERS in 2012; Ebola in 2014 and 2018; Zika in 2016 and the coronavirus in 2020.
explanation: Most of these diseases were discovered and spread before the election years and were minimally mentioned during campaigns. SARS, avian flu and MERS had virtually no effect on the U.S. during election years.

label: false
title: “The coronavirus has made it to Mississippi and the lady that caught it wasn’t around anybody with it, which means it is airborne. If the wind blows it in your direction, you’ll have it also.”
explanation: According to the CDC and Mississippi, there are no confirmed COVID-19 cases in the state as of 2/28/20. Researchers believe the disease is spread person to person.

label: false
title: The next thing that we will run short of, following masks, is toilet paper.
explanation: On Feb.28, the industry association released a statement categorically denying rumours that its production capacity fell (in the wake of the novel coronavirus). "Most (of Japan's) toilet paper and tissue paper are produced in domestic factories, and neither supplies nor production have been impacted by the novel coronavirus," it said.

label: false
title: Consuming alcohol is an effective measure against COVID-19.
explanation: The post making this claim contains a doctored screenshot from a CNN broadcast.

label: false
title: A “Lithuanian doctor” gives advice to those potentially infected with the coronavirus.
explanation: The information is false since instructions to stay at home if infected were not given out by any of the authorities.

label: false
title: Video shows Chinese officials detaining an infected citizen who refused to be tested.
explanation: The video shows an exercise, not a real event.

label: false
title: A man with a gas mask at a supermarket in Lugo (Galicia, Spain).
explanation: The photo was taken in Austria, not Spain.

label: false
title: It is best to shave your beard to avoid being infected by the coronavirus.
explanation: Unless you are in contact with people infected by the virus at work, there is no need to shave your beard.

label: partially false
title: The German government made a “secret plan” about coronavirus in 2012 that foretold the pandemic.
explanation: There is no secret plan but a public risk assessment of the German government in 2012 contained a hypothetical epidemic of a fictional coronavirus named Modi-SARS.

label: misleading
title: Health authorities say shaving a beard protects from COVID-19.
explanation: It's a 2017 graphic about how professionals should wear tight-fitting masks.

label: false
title: Airport in Karachi suspends all international arrivals during coronavirus epidemic.
explanation: Pakistan's civil aviation authority confirmed international arrivals weren't cancelled at the time; photo corresponds with one that circulated about flights suspended at the airport in March 2019

label: false
title: Coronavirus patients in China are caught by officials on a highway.
explanation: The video shows a mock drill. The China SWAT team in the video is "practicing" how to deal with coronavirus patients.

label: false
title: It is possible to self-diagnose by holding your breath for 10 seconds.
explanation: There is no medical evidence to support this claim.

label: false
title: COVID-19 is just a big flu.
explanation: It is too early to make this assumption. Statistics show COVID-19 is not a generic virus.

label: false
title: Chinese experts warn about a scar in the lung caused by COVID-19. This is more severe than SARS 17 years ago.
explanation: There is no evidence to support this. A Thai medical doctor insists that not every COVID-19 case damages the lungs.

label: false
title: French far right leader Marine Le Pen says the EU didn’t act against the outbreak
explanation: The EU has activated the civil protection mechanism, launched aid programs, mobilized funds for research and called for more international cooperation and coordination.

label: false
title: The cover of a book titled “Tintin in Wuhan” shows the character standing in an old Chinese market wearing special suits, while people are wearing masks.
explanation: This is a doctored image made from the frames of two different Tintin books.

label: misleading
title: Coronavirus is not reproducing in warm places.
explanation: Other coronaviruses have begun to die when the temperarture is over 56°C but there are no studies about COVID-19.

label: false
title: A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Chaco was confirmed.
explanation: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina as of 2/27/20.

label: false
title: An Argentinian doctor discovered a vaccine for coronavirus in Spain
explanation: The statement is false. The man in the attached photo is an actor. The WHO says "there is no vaccine and no specific antiviral medicine to prevent or treat" the coronavirus.

label: false
title: Video shows a person infected with coronavirus being detained by the police.
explanation: This event is not real, it's a drill. It was shot 2/21/19 at Henan Tongbai by the police and the emergency response team.

label: false
title: Bleach and chlorine can be used to prevent the coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO confirms bleach and other disinfectants might work to kill the coronavirus.

label: false
title: Lectures have been suspended at the University of Sevilla due to coronavirus.
explanation: The university stated the document is false.

label: misleading
title: Lysol products can kill the novel coronavirus.
explanation: While Lysol products are advertised to kill 99.9% of bacteria and viruses, including coronavirus, the company is referring to previous strains of the virus. There is no known cure for the novel coronavirus strain.

label: partially false
title: The WHO says the coronavirus might be spread by food.
explanation: The WHO has no evidence that infections from food are possible.

label: misleading
title: Iran’s deputy Health Minister
explanation: Flu death rate in the U.S. is less than 0.1% and the deputy minister’s comparison of flu and COVID-19 is misleading.

label: false
title: Holding your breath can test for COVID-19.
explanation: The WHO and other health experts said there is no evidence to support this claim.

label: false
title: A monkey is been infected with the coronavirus in this photo.
explanation: The photo is a capture of a video taken at least two months before the first COVID-19 symptoms were experienced.

label: misleading
title: Chloroquine cures COVID-19.
explanation: Chloroquine showed signs is not a cure for COVID-19.

label: false
title: A case of coronavirus in the Argentine province of Santiago del Estero was confirmed.
explanation: There are no confirmed cases of coronavirus in Argentina as of 2/27/20.

label: false
title: Sevilla’s university has suspended classes because of coronavirus on 2/27/20.
explanation: The university denied this claim on its Twitter account.

label: false
title: First case of coronavirus in Alcalá de Henares (Madrid).
explanation: One screenshot shows a false article created in an app; the other has not been published by El Mundo newspaper.

label: false
title: Honduras’s first confirmed case traveled to Taiwan earlier, which means there is a severe community transmission in Taiwan.
explanation: As of 2/27/20, Honduras has no confirmed cases of COVID-19. A Taiwanese traveler had suspected infection, but tested negative.

label: false
title: There is a new case of COVID-19 in Sacedón (Spain).
explanation: The town office denied the claim.

label: false
title: Iranian clerics wear masks after the outbreak.
explanation: The photo is outdated and manipulated. It was taken at the funeral of Kasem Sulemani.

label: mostly false
title: “The blood test for coronavirus costs $3,200.”
explanation: The CDC isn't charging for coronavirus testing but patients could be stuck with associated costs, such as a trip to the emergency room. In Florida, a man who worried he was infected initially faced a $3,270 bill even though he never received a coronavirus test.

label: false
title: El Pais said there is a possible case of coronavirus at the hospital Gregorio Marañón in Spain.
explanation: El País has not published that article and the typography doesn't match.

label: false
title: A brothel with 86 customers was quarantined after a prostitute tested positive for the coronavirus.
explanation: This was a satirical comment.

label: false
title: Dr. Gerardo Dovakin found a vaccine against coronavirus.
explanation: Dovakin is an actor, not a doctor.

label: false
title: Taiwan has severe community transmission. Many people have died.
explanation: As of 2/27/20, there is no evidence indicating the Taiwan government has hidden real COVID-19 figures or information. The Taiwan Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) has a daily press conference to update the latest confirmed case number and has been transparent.

label: false
title: Drinking water every 10 minutes can send the virus into sthe omach and kill it.
explanation: The digestive system cannot stop the respiratory system's work and the course of infection.

explanation: This post is fake.

label: misleading
title: COVID-19 is the name of the vaccine against the novel coronavirus.
explanation: According to information from the WHO, this is a false headline. There is no vaccine yet for the disease.

label: false
title: Seven children died from coronavirus within one week in Karimganj (Assam, India).
explanation: Public health officials have denied any coronavirus deaths. The children died in a span of two months due to fever and other illnesses.

label: false
title: Dr. Chao Chien Kuo from Wuhan Central Hospital said drinking alcohol can prevent COVID-19.
explanation: Dr. Chao Chien Kuo's comment was a joke in his private chat group, not an official recommendation. There is no evidence that drinking alcohol can prevent or treat COVID-19.

label: pants on fire!
title: 20 million Chinese people converted to Islam after it was proven that the coronavirus does not affect Muslims.
explanation: Video shows Chinese converting to Islam before the first reported case in Wuhan in 2019.

label: false
title: Data shows a massive release of sulfur dioxide gas near Wuhan.
explanation: The images are not satellite measurements, and a member of NASA said the images did not show a significant increase in SO2 measurements.

label: false
title: Chinese are converting to Islam to avoid the coronavirus.
explanation: The video is a religious activity carried out by ICDO in the Philippines that circulated on the internet before the coronavirus was first reported in December 2019.

label: false
title: A video shows a crow attack and a jumbo mosquito in China during the coronavirus plague.
explanation: The video was edited by combining several different videos and images.

label: misleading
title: This map shows the global spread of COVID-19.
explanation: The map shows flight paths worldwide. It does not show the movement of Wuhan residents.

label: false
title: Drinking alcohol kills the coronavirus.
explanation: Drinking alcohol does not cure coronavirus. Alcohol in sanitizers does have an effect on the virus.

label: false
title: A video shows the late Chinese doctor Li-wen Liang’s wedding party.
explanation: The video shows the wedding of a Taiwanese couple and was filmed in Taiwan.

label: misleading
title: Taking a hot bath is an effective remedy against COVID-19.
explanation: Health experts say there is no evidence that bathing in hot water can prevent the virus. The WHO warned that bathing or showering in very hot water can be “harmful."

label: false
title: Popping bubble wrap exposes people to coronavirus.
explanation: Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic.The claim is false.

label: false
title: Africans are more resistant to COVID-19.
explanation: Dr. Ngumbau Kitheka, a resident doctor at the Kenyatta National Hospital, told PesaCheck there is no scientific evidence to suggest black people have a better chance of fighting the virus, stating that the disease is likely to affect those with weaker immune systems.

label: false
title: Latest research by Chinese scientists said coronavirus will render most male patients infertile.
explanation: The study has not been peer-reviewed and does not say coronavirus will definitely cause infertility in men.

label: false
title: Consuming magnesium chloride, sodium bicarbonate, ginger and lemon juice prevents coronavirus infection.
explanation: No health organization has recommended consuming these products to prevent coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Thailand cures COVID-19 with anti-HIV drugs.
explanation: Thai doctors say their treatment helped a coronavirus patient recover, but it was not a "cure."

label: false
title: Swarms of crows attack the streets of Wuhan.
explanation: The videos are fake.

label: false
title: There is a COVID-19 case in Ethiopia.
explanation: There is no case in Ethiopia as of 2/17/20.

label: false
title: There is a COVID-19 case in east Indian state.
explanation: The local health authority said there are no confirmed novel coronavirus patients in the area as of 2/17/20.

label: false
title: A video claims to show an Eid prayer in China in December 2019.
explanation: This was a prayer in China in June 2019, unrelated to COVID-19.

label: false
title: A video shows a massive explosion in Wuhan, China, to control the spread of coronavirus.
explanation: The video dates back to 2015 when there were giant explosions at the Chinese port of Tianjin. The video has no connection with coronavirus.

label: false
title: This bottle of disinfectant gel proves that the coronavirus existed before 2019.
explanation: Different strains of coronavirus existed years before COVID-19, which explains why the term "coronavirus" is written on the bottle.

label: false
title: Video shows quarantined people in a building in Shanghai.
explanation: The video shows tower blocks in Shanghai, not Wuhan – and the clip has been edited to include the audio

label: false

label: false

explanation: The WHO says there is no known cure or vaccine for the coronavirus at this time.

label: false

title: A large amount of sulfur dioxide was observed in Wuhan because up to 14,000 bodies were incinerated.

label: no evidence
title: The coronavirus pandemic can be dramatically slowed, or stopped, with the immediate widespread use of high doses of vitamin C.
explanation: Maintaining an adequate intake of vitamin C is important for staying healthy. However, evidence from clinical trials shows that regular vitamin C supplementation does not prevent viral respiratory tract infections such as the common cold, which can be caused by coronaviruses, in the general population. Although some studies have shown a reduced incidence of the common cold in individuals undergoing severe physical stress, such as marathon runners.
claim_originated_by: Andrew W. Saul, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service

label: false

explanation: The BI clarified in a statement the foreigner's "escape" from NAIA's quarantine area is a hoax. The DOH did not issue an  advisory or bulletin about a foreigner who escaped the quarantine area.

title: An apartment in Wuhan went on fire after the owner over-sprayed ethanol. He turned on the heat, causing an explosion.
explanation: The video was filmed in Chongqing, not in Wuhan.

label: false
title: An Ecuadorian doctor saves lives during the Wuhan crisis.
explanation: Please click the link to read the full article

label: false
title: In Singapore, Hong Kong people ran into the supermarket in a panic to buy toilet paper.
explanation: The video was filmed in China and uploaded on 10/4/19.

label: false
title: Ginger ale is an effective cure for the 2019 novel coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO said drinking traditional herbal teas is “not specifically recommended as COVID-19 remedies as they are not effective to protect yourself and can even be harmful.”

label: false
title: Crackdown on drunken driving stopped due to risk of COVID-19 transmission
explanation: The crackdown is ongoing, and a separate operation.

label: false
title: There is a case of coronavirus in Caserta.
explanation: There is no case of coronavirus in Caserta as of 2/10/20

label: mostly false
title: A woman infected with the coronavirus was killed by Chinese police.
explanation: The woman in the video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China’s Heilongjiang province.

label: misleading
title: A video says weed kills coronavirus.
explanation: The news clip was created through a meme generator. The WHO has stated there are no cures for the virus.

label: misleading
title: Lysol disinfectant label says it’s tested against the new coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is unclear because it refers to a family of viruses.

label: false
title: Coronavirus has been found in broiler chicken.
explanation: The claim is fake.

label: false
title: The new coronavirus “causes sudden death syndrome.”
explanation: There is no evidence the virus causes sudden death syndrome.

label: misleading
title: China killed pigs over fear of coronavirus.
explanation: The video is misleading.

label: false
title: Cannibalism in China has caused the outbreak of a new strain of the coronavirus. A Chinese man is preparing a dead baby for consumption.
explanation: The photo shows a piece of performance art created by a Chinese artist in 2000.

label: misleading
title: Kazakhstanis burned and smashed Chinese restaurants and homes because of the spread of coronavirus in the country.
explanation: There is no connection between pogroms and coronavirus. It was an ethnic conflict between Kazakhs and Dungans that arose on domestic grounds

label: false
title: Autopsy reveals a Wuhan doctor was murdered in his sickbed.
explanation: There is no source cited in this report. Other news outlets confirmed Li Wenliang died from the coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Dettol cleaners can kill the coronavirus.
explanation: The coronavirus causing the current outbreak is new and there is no cure for it.

label: false
title: In a photo of Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan and Chinese President Xi Jinping, Imran Khan is wearing a mask.
explanation: The image was edited.

label: false
title: A video shows COVID-19 patients in China.
explanation: The video shows a school initiation in South Africa.

label: false
title: A video shows the cause of COVID-19.
explanation: The video has circulated since at least July 2011 and shows repairs being made to the roof of a bat-infested house in Miami, Florida.

label: false
title: Thai department of health published an infographic on how to properly wear face masks.
explanation: Ministtry of Health denied this.

label: misleading
title: A video shows people screaming in Wuhan because they feared the coronavirus.
explanation: The video shows Wuhan residents whistling and shouting to commemorate Dr. Li Wenliang, the whistleblower of the virus who died on 2/7/20 after getting infected.

label: misleading
title: The Asterix comic books and The Simpsons predicted the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: Coronavirus has been around since the 1960s. The Simpsons image was edited.

label: false
title: The WHO announced that among many medicines, the best coronavirus killer is nicotine.
explanation: The WHO hasn't made this recommendation. There is no cure for COVID-19.

label: false
title: Taking chlorine dioxide helps fight coronavirus.
explanation: Chlorine dioxide does guard against the coronavirus or against other diseases and is harmful.

label: false
title: A doctor said coronavirus can be alive in temperatures of 25-26C. Drinking hot water can help prevent it.
explanation: Coronavirus can be active in temperatures of 25-26C. Drinking hot water does not prevent it.

label: false
title: China seeks court approval to kill over 20,000 coronavirus patients to stop the spread of the outbreak.
explanation: There is no evidence that China went to courts seeking such approval.

label: misleading
title: Chinese president visits a mosque and says prayers about the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The video was taken in 2016, before the coronavirus was first reported in Wuhan in December 2019.

label: false
title: There is a patent for the new coronavirus.
explanation: A post claims the Pirbright Institute in the UK applied for a patent for the novel coronavirus outbreak, but documents show the institute holds a 2015 patent for avian influenza virus, also a coronavirus.

label: false
title: A photo shows the Biohazard Container Discovery at the American Consulate General in Wuhan.
explanation: No news was found from the Xinhua news agency or other media related to the findings of the biohazard container.

label: false
title: China is planning to kill coronavirus patients.
explanation: There is no information to prove that China plans to kill over 20,000 patients who have been infected by the coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Weed (cannabis) cures coronavirus.
explanation: The claim is misleading.

label: false
title: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a mosque amid the coronavirus outbreak and asked the people of the Muslim community to pray about present crisis.
explanation: Chinese President Xi Jinping’s visit to the mosque is not related to coronavirus. The video is nearly four years old.

label: false
title: The coronavirus has already existed, even in domestic animals, and there is a vaccine to fight it.
explanation: Wuhan coronavirus is not related to canine coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Tencent revealed the real number of deaths.
explanation: The screenshot is questionable.

label: false
title: A video shows the Vietnam government giving out free face masks on the streets.
explanation: The video documented a charity event organized by a motorcycle group, not the Vietnam government.

label: false
title: If you have a runny nose or cough, you don’t have COVID-19.
explanation: Runny nose and dry cough are two symptoms of COVID-19.

label: partially false
title: Government of the Philippines gave out free masks on the streets.
explanation: The government of the Philippines donated face masks to several organizations but didn't distribute face masks for free on the street as of 2/7/20.

label: misleading
title: Coronavirus has not “hit” Ghana.
explanation: There are reports of two suspects exhibiting symptoms of the virus, but both men tested negative, according to Dr. Asare, chief executive officer of Korle-Bu Teaching Hospital.

label: false
title: Xi Jinping visits a mosque for coronavirus.
explanation: The video is from July 2016.

label: misleading
title: Sanitizer manufacturer Dettol knew about the new coronavirus before it was reported.
explanation: Dettol label mentions it kills coronavirus, but does not refer to the current strain. The products have not been tested for the new strain.

label: false
title: China asks for permission to kill 20,000 infected cases.
explanation: There is no evidence about this.

label: false
title: Video shows bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China, that were the source of coronavirus.
explanation: The video was not taken in China. It’s a 2011 video uploaded on 7/5/11 by Miami based Istueta Roofing. The bats were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer.

label: false
title: President Xi Jinping visits Masjid to pray for coronavirus victims.
explanation: The video is from 2016 and shows Xi Jinping visiting a mosque.

label: misleading
title: Tencent claims that over 24,000 patients have died in China.
explanation: Screenshots can be manipulated; the number is not confirmed by the government.

label: false
title: Professor Wong Kin-Chung offers tips to delay the progress of COVID-19
explanation: There is no evidence that those items can prevent COVID-19. Wong Kin-Chung cannot be confirmed as a medical professor, doctor or nutritionist.

label: false
title: China has sought to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients to control the spread of the virus.
explanation: There is no evidence to support the claim, which originates from a suspicious website.

label: false
title: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang had dinner in Wuhan during the epidemic.
explanation: The photo was taken in 2013 in Sichuan.

label: false
title: The Dettol disinfectant label says COVID-19 was tested.
explanation: COVID-19 is a family of viruses.

label: false
title: Research shows that parts of the HIV genetic code have been inserted into the new coronavirus.
explanation: Researchers from India claim to have found HIV genetic sequences on the novel coronavirus, and speculate that it might indicate the new virus was artificially created. These genetic sequences can be found in many different viruses, including some other strains of coronavirus.

label: false
title: Chinese court gave permission to kill 20,000 patients infected with coronavirus.
explanation: There is no evidence that the Chinese court had ordered to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients.

label: false
title: China is planning to kill coronavirus patients.
explanation: A hoax website, which has been called out multiple times by various fact-checkers for spreading fake news, has published an article without any source of information to claim that China is planning to kill over 20,000 patients who have been infected by coronavirus.

label: false
title: Video shows people behaving abnormally in China due to coronavirus.
explanation: The video is old and does not show the recent coronavirus outbreak.

label: false
title: Vitamin C stops or slows novel coronavirus.
explanation: There no known cure for coronavirus and no evidence to suggest Vitamin C can treat or prevent it.
claim_originated_by: Health Impact News, Orthomolecular Medicine News Service

label: false
title: Coronavirus discovered In broiler chicken.
explanation: Unrelated images of ailing chickens claim coronavirus has been discovered in broiler chicken.

label: false
title: WHO calls for isolation of China due to the coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO does not recommend restrictions on travel or trade with China.

label: false
title: China is seeking court’s approval to kill all who tested positive with coronavirus.
explanation: The National Health Commission of the People’s Republic of China makes no mention of any such case.

label: false
title: Share this post on Facebook, and get free face masks.
explanation: Taiwan FactCheck Center has shared the post but didn't get any feedback. The post was not deleted or revised.

label: false
title: A Bulgarian doctor claims that alcohol helps cure or prevent the new coronavirus.
explanation: The WHO says an alcohol-based hand sanitizer is recommended. It is a well known fact that there is no cure for the virus.

label: misleading
title: Woman eats bat soup contaminated with coronavirus in China.
explanation: The video was recorded on the island of Palau, Micronesia in 2016.

label: false
title: Coronavirus was created in a laboratory in Wuhan.
explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim.

label: false
title: People infected with coronavirus die in the street while doctors travel through the infection zone.
explanation: The images are from different events. The first photo corresponds to a performance in Germany and the second portrays two doctors caring for Ebola sufferers in Uganda.

label: false
title: The label on Dettol disinfectant spray claims it is proven to “kill coronavirus;” the company knew about the new strain since 2019.
explanation: The recent outbreak in China is COVID-19. The source of infection, animal host and reservoir are currently unknown.

label: false
title: Video shows an infected baby with a doctor.
explanation: Video was uploaded on 1/14/20. There was no reported case at that time. It does not fit the COVID-19 quarantine protocol.

label: false
title: Coronavirus found in broiler chicken
explanation: No evidence proves this claim. The WHO has clarified that meat cooked properly can be consumed.

label: false
title: Ultimo (Italian singer) has coronavirus.
explanation: As of 2/6/20 in Italy, there are only 2 cases of coronavirus (2 Chinese citizens).

label: false
title: You can’t transmit the virus to other people if you don’t feel its symptoms.
explanation: The French health minister corrected this misinformation.

label: false
title: China seeks approval from the court to kill over 20 000 coronavirus patients.
explanation: There is no evidence to support this claim.

label: false
title: Videos show pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The videos are old and not related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.

label: false
title: The novel coronavirus can be cured by one bowl of freshly boiled garlic.
explanation: The WHO has issued a clarification that garlic may have some antimicrobial properties but there is no evidence it can protect people from the novel coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: Dettol sanitizer can kill tthe coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus back in 2019.
explanation: The Dettol bottle refers to the previous strains of coronavirus, not COVID-19. The manufacturer cannot confirm levels of effectiveness against the new strain.

label: false
title: Several posts say that coronavirus deaths are linked to 5G technology.
explanation: There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory. People die because they were infected with the virus SARS-CoV-2.

label: false
title: The new coronavirus can be cured with a bowl of garlic water.
explanation: There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory and there is still no cure to the COVID-19 disease.

label: false
title: There is a case of COVID-19 in Alberta, Canada, on 2/5/20.
explanation: Authorities deny it.

label: misleading
title: Tinospira crispa plants can treat COVID-19.
explanation: Philippine health experts dismiss the claim that tinospora crispa plants can treat novel coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: “Coronavirus epidemic in Poland.”
explanation: There is no claim or statement by Polish officials of an epidemic

label: misleading
title: A study is linked to coronavirus.
explanation: The study was linked to filoviruses and had the minimal role of Wuhan's virology institute.

label: false
title: This is a market in China where bats and snakes were served as food.
explanation: The market was in Indonesia.

label: false
title: Doctors confirm the novel coronavirus may arrive in Brazil through AliExpress packages.
explanation: Specialists agree it's unlikely that a virus would survive more than a few hours outside a host, on a solid surface.

label: false
title: A case of the novel coronavirus was registered in a hospital in Maranhão, Brazil.
explanation: It was a different type of coronavirus, HCoV-OC43, which causes regular colds.

label: false
title: Coronavirus has infected broiler chicken.
explanation: There is no evidence that broiler chicken has been infected with coronavirus.

label: false
title: Boiled garlic water can protect from COVID-19.
explanation: Health experts refute claims that drinking boiled garlic water cures novel coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: The health insurance fee in South Korea will increase because of the treatment cost for Chinese patients.
explanation: The cost of treatment for foreigners will be paid from the state budget, not byinsurance companies.

label: false
title: A photo shows people in China fainting on the street after they were infected with the coronavirus
explanation: The photo was taken in 2014 in Germany while commemorating Holocaust victims.

label: false
title: Spain’s Health Secretary advises against selling products from China.
explanation: The Health Secretary has denied making such recommendations.

label: false
title: The novel coronavirus contains “pShuttle-SN” sequence, proving laboratory origin.
explanation: The pShuttle-SN vector was designed by researchers seeking to develop a potential SARS vaccine. The new coronavirus does not contain a sequence from the pShuttle-SN vector.
claim_originated_by: Alex Jones, Info Wars; Mike Adams, Natural News

label: false
title: Chinese prime minister visits a mosque following the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The man in the video is former Malaysian Prime Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi. The video was shot during his visit to Beijing’s Nan Xia Po Mosque in July 2015.

label: false
title: Children under 8 are immune to the novel coronavirus.
explanation: WHO reports indicate children as young as 2 have been infected.
claim_originated_by: Socila Media and some News Agencies

label: false
title:
1. Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang visited a mosque and seek protection to the country from coronavirus. 
2. Chinese president Xi Jinping visited a mosque in China after realizing the fact that only Allah can save China from this epidemic.
explanation: The first video is of former malaysian Prime Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi who visited a mosque in China during his visit in 2015. The second video is also an old one, President Xi Jinping paid a visit to the Xincheng Mosque in Yinchuan city, capital of NW China's Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region on Tuesday, July 19, 2016.

label: false
title: Coronavirus is caused by bat soup.
explanation: There is no evidence that eating bat soup causes coronavirus.

label: false
title: Rinsing your mouth with salted water will prevent coronavirus infection.
explanation: A doctor's team has debunked the claim

label: misleading
title: Cow urine cures coronavirus.
explanation: This claim made by Hindu Mahasabha President Swami Chakrapani is misleading.

label: false
title: Label on disinfectant says the new coronavirus strain is not new.
explanation: The disinfectant can only eliminate other types of coronaviruses that are found on hard and non-porous surfaces. It is not effective on the new coronavirus.

label: false
title: Health Canada has advised that keeping the throat moist by drinking water can prevent infection.
explanation: There is no scientific evidence from Health Canada to support this claim.

label: false
title: “The Simpsons” predicted the new coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The episode referred to a flu from Japan, not China, and one of the photos was manipulated.

label: misleading
title: Farts were recorded by infrared temperature sensors recently installed in airports and train stations to monitor temperatures of passengers amid the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The farts were added digitally.

label: misleading
title: Confirmed cases of coronavirus have been found in Shaheen Bagh, Delhi.
explanation: There have been three cases of coronavirus in India as of 2/5/20.

label: false
title: First case of coronavirus in San Vicente del Raspeig (Alicante, Spain).
explanation: There has been no case detected in Alicante.

label: false
title: When the first group of Japanese evacuated from Wuhan to Tokyo, each evacuee took one ambulance.
explanation: Among 206 Japanese evacuees being withdrawn from Wuhan on 1/29/20, 199 took seven buses and five took ambulances to the hospital for further examination.

label: false
title: When transporting patients, people who wear only a facial mask violate safety measures.
explanation: They also use ambulances with negative pressure ventilation equipment.

label: false
title: There are 40,000 Chinese foreign workers in Morowali quarantined with coronavirus.
explanation: Only 5,390 foreign workers are employed at the company.

label: misleading
title: Face masks can be steamed for reuse.
explanation: Experts warn against it.

label: false
title: Videos show pigs being buried in China due to the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The videos are old and not related to the recent coronavirus outbreak.

label: false
title: A photo shows a Japanese medical professional providing aid in Wuhan.
explanation: The photo has circulated in reports about a Japanese medical team traveling to China in 2008.

label: misleading
title: 300.000 people are infected with the new coronavirus in China.
explanation: The number is lower, according to China.

label: misleading
title: Sri Lanka has eradicated coronavirus.
explanation: One patient recovered but experts said it's not enough to mention eradication.

label: false
title: People from Wuhan can share a laundry room although they are in quarantine.
explanation: People in Wuhan should clean their clothes in their room, by themselves.

label: false
title: COVID-19 comes from rhino horns.
explanation: The origin is unknown and rhino horns cannot hold any virus.

label: partially false
title: Chinese kill their pets due to epidemic anxiety.
explanation: A photo of a dead dog was verified. There is no evidence of a massive pet killing in China.

label: false
title: Macedonian citizens are afraid to order from AliExpress because of coronavirus.
explanation: According to the Post Office, the coronavirus is not transmitted by packages.

label: false
title: Weed, slang for the cannabis plant, can “kill coronavirus.”
explanation: As of 2/18/20, the WHO said "there is still no specific medicine recommended to prevent or treat" the novel coronavirus.

label: misleading
title: The Chinese prime minister visited a mosque to gain protection for coronavirus.
explanation: The 2015 video is of the Malaysian Prime minister visiting a mosque in Beijing.

label: misleading
title: The Chinese president visits a mosque to ask Muslims to pray to fight the coronavirus.
explanation: The video dates back to 2016, when Chinese President Xi Jinping visited a mosque in northwest China.

label: false
title: Prime Minister of China visited a mosque and realized the only protection from coronavirus is to bow before Allah.
explanation: The Associated Press archive video was uploaded in 2015 and shows ex-Malaysian Prime Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi visiting a mosque in China in 2004, not during the coronavirus outbreak.

label: false
title: There is a confirmed case of coronavirus in the Macarthur Region of Australia.
explanation: This news has not been reported by any news outlets.

label: misleading
title: A case of novel coronavirus has occurred in Huelva, Spain.
explanation: As of 2/3/20, there hasn't been any cases of novel coronavirus in Huelva, Spain.

label: false
title: Video from China shows people fleeing from coronavirus quarantine.
explanation: The video is from an anti-government protest that was posted in December 2019 before the coronavirus quarantine began.

label: false
title: Video shows pigs buried alive.
explanation: This video is from January 2019.

label: false
title: Broiler chickens were found to have coronavirus in Mumbai.
explanation: Chickens have not been identified as a source for the coronavirus and the photos are not linked to coronavirus.

label: false
title: A neighbor of Noia (region of Galicia, Spain) has been infected with the coronavirus.
explanation: The photo has been altered and it has not been published. There has been no new case of coronavirus in Spain.

label: false
title: Coronavirus is not new; there is a vaccine for dogs.
explanation: The current outbreak was caused by a new strain.

label: false
title: Video of Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang visiting a mosque and offering prayers seeking protection to the country from coronavirus.
explanation: The man in the video is not Chinese Prime Minister Li Keqiang. He is former Malaysian Prime Minister Abdullah Ahmad Badawi. The video was taken in 2015 and shows Badawi visiting Nan Xia Po Mosque in Beijing for Friday prayers.

label: false
title: “Kochi Prefectural Assembly, who returned from Wuhan, refused the test while it was infected with coronavirus.”
explanation: No coronavirus infection has been confirmed in Kochi Prefecture, and no tests have been carried out.

label: false
title: A Sri Lankan girl finds a cure for coronavirus.
explanation: There is no cure for coronavirus yet.

label: false
title: Video shows a family that died from novel coronavirus.
explanation: The video was found on the internet since the last week of December 2019. But the first death from the novel coronavirus was not reported until the second week of January 2020.

label: false
title: A Postobon tank in Colombia was infected with coronavirus and all sodas were contaminated.
explanation: The company and the Ministry of Health deny the infection

label: false
title: Pigs mulled in China are blamed for coronavirus.
explanation: The video is from the African swine flu outbreak in China in 2018-19.

label: misleading
title: Dettol sanitizer kills coronavirus and the company knew about the existence of the virus before the outbreak in China.
explanation: Dettol kills older strains of coronavirus but has not been tested on the new strain.

label: false
title: A doctor faints during surgery on a coronavirus patient.
explanation: The video shows a doctor fainting during open heart surgery. It was recorded in a hospital of Zhotong in Yunnan, China.

label: misleading
title: Chickens cause coronavirus.
explanation: There has been no confirmation of a link between chickens and the new coronavirus. The WHO has said that it is looking into animal sources.

label: false
title: Video shows bat infestation under a tiled roof, the source of coronavirus in Hubei, China.
explanation: The video is 8 years old and not from China.

label: false
title: Dr. Zhong Nanshan said saline solution can kill the virus.
explanation: Several Chinese media outlets and experts say this is false.

label: false
title: Study indicates that black tea and Pu’er tea can prevent coronavirus
explanation: There has been no evidence to suggest that drinking tea has protected people from infection.

label: false
title: Coronavirus can be transmitted through sweat from Chinese canned food factory workers.
explanation: Transmission of the coronavirus is only possible through close contact and body fluid when sneezing and coughing.

label: false
title: “It is not safe to receive a letter or a package from China.”
explanation: According to the WHO and other experts, people receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting the new coronavirus.

label: false
title: A doctor named Leslie Chow discovered the coronavirus and died after contact with coronavirus patients.
explanation: The photo corresponds with American actor Ken Jeong. The doctor Lin Wenliang was the first to warn of the risk of coronavirus.

label: false
title: There is a person with coronavirus in Huelva on 2/4/20.
explanation: According to the Spanish Health Ministry, there is just one case of coronavirus in Spain at this time. The image has been manipulated.

label: false
title: A coronavirus victim was secretly cremated.
explanation: The boxes photographed at Tianhe International Airport in Wuhan contain protective clothing bought by the Zall Foundation to help control the coronavirus.

label: false
title: There is a person with coronavirus in Galicia on 2/4/20.
explanation: According to the Spanish Health Ministry, there has been just one case of coronavirus in Spain until now. The image has been manipulated.

label: explanatory
title: We made a Q&A of what we know about the videos of people fainting in the middle of the street.

label: false
title: Photos show coronavirus is found in broiler chicken.
explanation: The photos are outdated and have nothing to do with the coronavirus. They are about sick chickens.

label: false
title: A photo shows infected people in China.
explanation: The photo was taken in 2014 in Frankfurt in memory of Holocaust victims.

label: false
title: According to the Chinese CDC, tea can reduce the risk of contracting coronavirus.
explanation: Chinese CDC has not published such a study. There is no evidence that tea cures the coronavirus.

label: false
title: This image is related to the coronavirus outbreak.
explanation: The image has nothing to do with coronavirus.

label: false
title: A video shows domesticated and exotic animals being sold in a wet market in Wuhan, China.
explanation: The video is a composite of two different clips, one of Langowan Traditional Market and the other of Tomohon Traditional Market, both in Indonesia.

label: misleading
title: There is an herbal cure for COVID-19.
explanation: Health experts in Sri Lanka say there is no evidence asafoetida or other herbal medicines can protect people from infection.

label: false
title: Japan has sent a 1,000-man medical team to Wuhan.
explanation: Taken on 5/20/08, the image shows a 22-member medical team at Japan’s Narita International Airport before flying to Chengdu city in China, hit by an earthquake.

label: false
title: South Korean presidential Blue House forbids the term “Wuhan pneumonia.”
explanation: The information was based on guidance from the WHO.

label: false
title: Video shows bats found under the tiles of many roofs in Hubei, China. They were the source of the coronavirus.
explanation: The video was not taken in China. It’s a video from 7/5/11 by a Miami based roofing company, Istueta Roofing. The bats in the video were found under the tiles during the process of replacing a roof for a customer in Miami.

label: false
title: The novel coronavirus “will not spread” in the Philippines due to the country’s high temperature and relatively high humidity.
explanation: The World Health Organization (WHO) told Rappler that 2019-nCoV "has spread to countries with both hot and humid climates, as well as cold and dry."

label: mostly false
title: Coronavirus has killed 112,000 people and infected 2,800,000 in China.
explanation: Currently, the coronavirus has killed more than 400 people and infected over 20,000 in China.

label: misleading
title: Three photos show coronavirus hospitals In China.
explanation: The photos are misleading.

label: false
title: Alibaba Group founder Jack Ma gave US$5 million to a Filipino student who developed a vaccine for novel coronavirus.
explanation: No vaccine has been developed to stop the new coronavirus. Jack Ma's donation to a Filipino student cannot be confirmed.

label: misleading
title: Dettol sanitizer can kill coronavirus. The company knew about the coronavirus in 2019.
